title: 1998 Nissan Skyline 25GT Turbo 5-Speed at No Reserve
description: This 1998 Nissan Skyline 25GT Turbo was sold new in Japan and imported into the US in January 2024. The car is finished in Active Red over gray cloth upholstery, and power comes from a turbocharged 2.5-liter RB25DET inline-six paired with a five-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber hood, GT-R–style bodywork, 19" Kansai wheels, a Blitz turbo timer, an A'PEXi FC Commander, an HKS CAMP 2 display, an aftermarket air intake, a front-mount intercooler, and an SP Sports EXAS Evo Tune exhaust center section and muffler. This R34 Skyline is now offered by the selling dealer in Illinois at no reserve with a clean Georgia title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 1998 Nissan Skyline 25GT Turbo 5-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #181,398.
text: This 1998 Nissan Skyline 25GT Turbo was sold new in Japan and imported into the US in January 2024. The car is finished in Active Red over gray cloth upholstery, and power comes from a turbocharged 2.5-liter RB25DET inline-six paired with a five-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber hood, GT-R–style bodywork, 19″ Kansai wheels, a Blitz turbo timer, an A’PEXi FC Commander, an HKS CAMP 2 display, an aftermarket air intake, a front-mount intercooler, and an SP Sports EXAS Evo Tune exhaust center section and muffler. This R34 Skyline is now offered by the selling dealer in Illinois at no reserve with a clean Georgia title. The car is finished in Active Red (AR2) and has been fitted with a carbon-fiber hood and a GT-R–style rear spoiler, bumpers, badges, and side skirts. The selling dealer notes that the front lip has been repaired in preparation of the sale. Staggered-width 19″ Kansei wheels are mounted with Haida tires. The car was factory-equipped with HICAS four-wheel steering and four-wheel disc brakes. Ultra Racing chassis braces have been added. The right-hand-drive cabin features bolstered bucket seats upholstered in gray cloth. Aftermarket additions include a Japanese-market touchscreen stereo, a Blitz turbo timer, and an A’PEXi FC Commander. The leather-wrapped Personal steering wheel frames a 180-km/h speedometer, a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline and an inset oil pressure gauge, and readouts for fuel level and coolant temperature. An HKS CAMP 2 display has been fitted in the center of the dashboard and includes readouts for water temperature, boost pressure, battery voltage, and oil pressure and temperature. The digital odometer shows 115k kilometers (~71k miles). The turbocharged 2.5-liter RB25DET Neo inline-six has been fitted with an aftermarket air intake, a front-mount intercooler, and an SP Sports EXAS Evo Tune exhaust center section and muffler. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission. The model code reveals the following details: G – Two-door coupe GK – 2.5-liter RB25DET inline-six B – two-wheel drive with HICAS rear-wheel steering R – Right-hand drive T – 25GT Turbo F – Five-speed manual transmission R34 – Model U – Turbocharged D – Standard climate package A – Four person capacity K – Rear wiper, Xenon headlights, privacy glass, and rear spoiler J – Glovebox light, remote control entry, and trunk lid trim You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 1998 Nissan Skyline 25GT Turbo was sold new in Japan and imported into the US in January 2024. The car is finished in Active Red over gray cloth upholstery, and power comes from a turbocharged 2.5-liter RB25DET inline-six paired with a five-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes a carbon-fiber hood, GT-R–style bodywork, 19″ Kansai wheels, a Blitz turbo timer, an A’PEXi FC Commander, an HKS CAMP 2 display, an aftermarket air intake, a front-mount intercooler, and an SP Sports EXAS Evo Tune exhaust center section and muffler. This R34 Skyline is now offered by the selling dealer in Illinois at no reserve with a clean Georgia title.

The car is finished in Active Red (AR2) and has been fitted with a carbon-fiber hood and a GT-R–style rear spoiler, bumpers, badges, and side skirts. The selling dealer notes that the front lip has been repaired in preparation of the sale.

Staggered-width 19″ Kansei wheels are mounted with Haida tires. The car was factory-equipped with HICAS four-wheel steering and four-wheel disc brakes. Ultra Racing chassis braces have been added.

The right-hand-drive cabin features bolstered bucket seats upholstered in gray cloth. Aftermarket additions include a Japanese-market touchscreen stereo, a Blitz turbo timer, and an A’PEXi FC Commander.

The leather-wrapped Personal steering wheel frames a 180-km/h speedometer, a tachometer with a 7k-rpm redline and an inset oil pressure gauge, and readouts for fuel level and coolant temperature. An HKS CAMP 2 display has been fitted in the center of the dashboard and includes readouts for water temperature, boost pressure, battery voltage, and oil pressure and temperature. The digital odometer shows 115k kilometers (~71k miles).

The turbocharged 2.5-liter RB25DET Neo inline-six has been fitted with an aftermarket air intake, a front-mount intercooler, and an SP Sports EXAS Evo Tune exhaust center section and muffler.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a five-speed manual transmission.

The model code reveals the following details:

  • G – Two-door coupe
  • GK – 2.5-liter RB25DET inline-six
  • B – two-wheel drive with HICAS rear-wheel steering
  • R – Right-hand drive
  • T – 25GT Turbo
  • F – Five-speed manual transmission
  • R34 – Model
  • U – Turbocharged
  • D – Standard climate package
  • A – Four person capacity
  • K – Rear wiper, Xenon headlights, privacy glass, and rear spoiler
  • J – Glovebox light, remote control entry, and trunk lid trim
